Applies to

Scala and Play Framework 2.1.0+

What to Do

Make inactive sessions time-out.

Why

Make sessions expire after a period of inactivity to make it harder for an attacker to hijack a session.

How

To make inactive sessions time-out:

  1. Identify login functionality. Find code that handles user logins.

  2. Add code that sets the inactive session time-out period. There is no technical timeout for the Session. It expires when the user closes the web browser. 

    If you need a functional timeout for a specific application, store a timestamp into the user Session and use it in the way your application needs (e.g. for a maximum session duration, maximum inactivity duration, etc.). This link explains how to add session timeout functionality to the application. 

Additional Resources

  • For more information about the method, please see: https://github.com/jroper/play-security-utils/blob/master/src/main/scala/play/security/utils/SessionTimeoutAction.scala
